intro: Lonicera gracilipes var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth honeysuckle, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It features slender, arching stems that often grow along the ground or climb low structures. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of yellow to orange, typically blooming in late spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, contributing to its varietal name "glabra." This species is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade to full sun.
